modules.description: Provides operations to create a position value from a specific argument, compare two position values, and convert a position to its string representation. Works with the abstract type `t` and a concrete type `pos0_arg` used for initialization. Used to generate unique identifiers for source code positions in compiler tools.

Converts a single character into its string representation. Operates on character values to produce corresponding string literals. Useful for generating output in systems that require string-based token representations.

Provides operations to create a position value from a unit argument, compare positions, and convert positions to strings. Works with a custom type representing string positions and a unit type for initialization. Used to track and manipulate cursor positions in text processing tasks.

Provides functions to create a position from a file name, compare positions, and convert positions to strings. Works with file positions represented as a custom type and file names as input. Used to track and display source code locations during parsing or error reporting.

Provides operations to create a character representation from a position argument, compare characters, and convert characters to strings. Works with a custom type `t` representing characters and a type `pos0_arg` used as input for creation. Used to generate human-readable character labels from numerical positions in a structured format.

This module offers parsing capabilities through monadic combinators, enabling operations like sequencing, choice, and repetition on token streams while tracking positions and handling errors. It manipulates token values derived from characters and employs a stateful parser type to manage sequence matching, range extraction, and string construction. Use cases include lexing structured text, validating input formats, and building custom parsing pipelines with precise error diagnostics.

This module offers parsing combinators for sequential, conditional, and repetitive token processing, along with error handling and state management. It operates on custom `token` and `pos` types, enabling structured file analysis and precise position tracking. Use cases include parsing configuration files, handling nested data formats, and implementing robust token validation with optional parsing capabilities.

Provides combinators for building parsers that track position information, enabling precise error reporting. Operates on input streams and returns results with location data. Useful for parsing structured text where error messages need to indicate exact positions in the input.

Provides operations to create a position from a specific argument, compare positions, and convert positions to strings. Works with a custom type `t` representing positions and a related argument type `pos0_arg`. Used to generate human-readable representations of positions and enforce ordering in path-related computations.
